title: Expert Training in Water Demand Management (WDM) and Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) Through Scientific Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental water resource management concepts, awareness of urban water issues, and skills in scientific inquiry methods and basic experimental design
context.additional_context: Emphasizes practical competencies to address "water poverty" in urban areas of Southern Africa. Provides immersive learning via smartphone-based VR simulations. Includes training in data-driven decision-making using scientific measurement and analysis tools.

learning_goals: Establishing a Plan to Improve Water Use Efficiency by 20% by Developing a WDM Strategy Based on Scientific Data Analysis Within the IWRM Framework
Executing a Stakeholder Consultation Process and Deriving Optimal Conclusions Based on Scientific Evidence in a Water Supply Crisis Scenario Through VR Simulation

Developing WDM Educational Materials Tailored to Local Community Characteristics and Effectively Delivering Them to End-User Groups (Medical/Legal/Technical Professionals) Using Field Observation and Experimental Data

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
